DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oral Gas Anesthetic Agent Use Additional Training and Education Training and Education Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth._A fluid in the gaseous state having neither independent shape nor volume and being able to expand indefinitely._(an-es-THET-iks) Substances that cause loss of feeling or awareness. Local anesthetics cause loss of feeling in a part of the body. General anesthetics put the person to sleep._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary)_To teach theory and hands on experience_To teach theory and hands on experience_An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Oral Gas Anesthetic Agent Use Additional Training and Education
Property.preferredDefinition: Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:A fluid in the gaseous state having neither independent shape nor volume and being able to expand indefinitely.:(an-es-THET-iks) Substances that cause loss of feeling or awareness. Local anesthetics cause loss of feeling in a part of the body. General anesthetics put the person to sleep.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:Added; extra. Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.
A fluid in the gaseous state having neither independent shape nor volume and being able to expand indefinitely.
A pharmacological agent that acts in a reversible fashion and can be applied either locally or systemically to cause a partial or total loss of sensation and pain or to induce unconsciousness.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
To teach theory and hands on experience

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: To teach theory and hands on experience_An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Which response best represent
ReferenceDocuments.description: Which response best represents the desire you have to receive additional training in providing the following procedure: Nitrous oxide plus oral sedation?
